intro: Amoora rubiginosa, commonly known as the red-flowered ghost tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and showy red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is known for its ability to thrive in humid, shaded environments, often found in lowland rainforests. Its bark and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. The tree also plays a role in supporting local biodiversity by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
